pullRequest.title: Fix smtp.ssl.trust setting for watcher email
pullRequest.bodyText:
The ssl.trust setting for Watcher provides a list of hostnames that
should be automatically trusted for SSL hostname verification. It was
accidentally broken when we added the full ssl.* settings for email
notifications (see #45272)
This commit corrects this, so the setting is once again respected,
as long as none of the other ssl settings are configured for email
notifications.
Resolves: #52153

commit.message:
Fix smtp.ssl.trust setting for watcher email

The ssl.trust setting for Watcher provides a list of hostnames that
should be automatically trusted for SSL hostname verification. It was
accidentally broken when we added the full ssl.* settings for email
notifications (see #45272)

This commit corrects this, so the setting is once again respected,
as long as none of the other ssl settings are configured for email
notifications.

Resolves: #52153

nodes.bodyText:
The word "explicit" is a bit vague to me. Both "mail.smtp.ssl" and "xpack.notification.email.ssl" feel explicit to me. Also isExplicitlyConfigured means  "xpack.notification.email.ssl" is not empty, which is opposite to what it means here.
Maybe change it to something like:
Specific smtp SSL settings [{}] of account [{}] will be ignored due to notification SSL settings [{}].
Or we could even drop the word "Specific" and just say "smtp ...", since it feels odds for specific settings to be overridden by more general settings.
Is this accurate? The verfication_mode should be set to full in the below code since ssl.trust gets overridden?
